*Value Statement:* As a member of the BIP-AI infrastructure team, I need to prototype the infrastructure control panel.

*A/C:* - Prototype the infrastructure control panel which would give access to team members to run and control the platform through a Gateway accessible panel.

summary: Remake AI team API Metrics Grafna dashboard
description:
Title: Remake AI team API Metrics Grafana dashboard

### Value Statement As a platform engineer monitoring system health and performance, I need a unified Grafana dashboard that displays API metrics from all AI team microservices so that I can quickly identify issues, track performance trends, and ensure service reliability across the platform.

### Acceptance Criteria When a user views the AI team API Metrics Grafana dashboard, the dashboard displays comprehensive metrics from all AI team microservices with proper visualization and alerting capabilities. - Dashboard pulls metrics data from gateway microservice and mfes - Dashboard pulls metrics data from crossplane-manager microservice - Dashboard pulls metrics data from mlops-manager microservice - API request rates, latencies, and error rates are visualized for each service - HTTP status code distributions are displayed per service - Resource utilization metrics (CPU, memory, connections) are included - Dashboard includes appropriate time range selectors and refresh intervals - Panels are organized logically by service and metric type - Alerts are configured for critical thresholds (high error rates, elevated latencies) - Dashboard is deployed to all environments (dev, sbx, stage, preprod) - Documentation includes dashboard usage guide and metric definitions

summary: eMPWR: KT for onboarding new SE to tenant
Refactor claims values files into modular components to reduce complexity and improve maintainability
description:
Title: Refactor claims values files into modular components to reduce complexity and improve maintainability

**Title:** Refactor claims values files into modular components to reduce complexity and improve maintainability **Story:** As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I want to organize claim values into separate files so that file complexity is reduced and maintenance is simplified. **Assumptions:** - File structure changes are compatible with existing ArgoCD application sets and Helm rendering - Multiple values files or include mechanisms are supported by the chart structure **Acceptance Criteria:** - Given existing claims values files when I establish a baseline then I generate and save the rendered chart output for each environment - Given refactored values files when I render the charts then the output matches the baseline for all environments with no functional changes - Given the new file organization when separating resource groups then each values file is focused on a single concern and is easier to navigate - Given the refactored structure when I deploy to SBX environment then all claims deploy successfully without errors - Given the new file organization when documentation is updated then it clearly explains the structure, file naming conventions, and how to modify values **Definition of Done:** - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (chart rendering validation for all environments) - Documentation updated (README with new structure explanation) - Successfully deployed and validated in SBX environment - Baseline and post-refactor chart outputs verified as identical

summary: Update resource naming conventions to use application ID for tag manager compatibility and consistency
description:
Title: Update resource naming conventions to use application ID for tag manager compatibility and consistency

Story: As a BIP-AI Infrastructure Engineer, I want to replace product-tenant with application ID in all naming conventions so that templates are consistent with the tenant directory, costing, and the new tag manager. Assumptions: - Application ID values match the product-tenant combination (e.g., product "bip" + tenant "ai" = application ID "bip-ai") - The new tag manager requires application ID for proper resource tagging Acceptance Criteria: - Given all composition and template files when I replace product-tenant references with application ID then all naming conventions use the new format - Given the updated naming conventions when I compare generated resource names then no actual name changes occur due to value equivalence - Given updated templates when I render charts for all environments then the output matches expected resource names - Given the refactored templates when I deploy to SBX environment then all resources deploy successfully with correct tags - Given the new naming convention when documentation exists then it is updated to reflect the application ID usage Definition of Done: - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (chart rendering validation for all environments) - Documentation updated (if applicable) - Successfully deployed and validated in SBX environment - All composition and template files updated consistently

summary: Promote latest updates to grafana alerts in dev to upper envs
description:
Title: Promote latest updates to grafana alerts in dev to upper envs

Value Statement:
As an MLOps engineer who manages monitoring and alerting configurations, I need the ability to create and route Grafana alerts in upper environments based on existing lower-environment configurations so that model performance issues and infrastructure anomalies are consistently surfaced to the appropriate Slack channels across all environments.

Acceptance Criteria:
-When updated dashboards and metrics are available in upper environments, corresponding Grafana alerts are created using the same configuration logic and thresholds as lower environments.
-Alerts are validated to route correctly to existing non-prod and prod Slack channels with appropriate annotations (e.g., environment, model name, and alert type).
-Documentation detailing alert creation, Slack routing configuration, and validation steps is updated.
-Manual validation or automated test confirms alerts trigger and deliver expected messages to Slack.

pts: 3

AC: A single Jenkins pipeline is created in all environments that attaches the BIP AI Stable Jupyterlab and CodeEditor LCCs and attaches the custom image all in one combined pipeline Documentation should be added on how to run this pipeline Should be able to be run on new domains as well as updating existing domains, and should be run automatically when a new mlkit version is released

summary: Promote latest updates to mlops dashboard in dev to upper envs
description:
Title: Promote latest updates to mlops dashboard in dev to upper envs

Value Statement:
As an MLOps engineer who manages dashboard deployments, I need the ability to promote updated Grafana dashboards (including Bedrock metrics and model name updates) to upper environments so that users in all environments have consistent visibility into Bedrock model performance.

Acceptance Criteria:
- When the updated dashboards are validated in development, they are promoted to upper Grafana environments using the approved deployment or import process.
- Data source configurations and permissions are verified to ensure panels render correctly in upper environments.
- Documentation describing dashboard promotion steps and environment-specific differences is updated.
- A manual validation checklist or automated test confirms that dashboards render correctly post-promotion.

description:

Acceptance Criteria: - Jupyter notebook explaining core Comprehend concepts relevant to BIP-AI. - Functional code moved to mlkit - enforced tagging of resources.

summary: Design for tenant cloudwatch differentiation for logs and metrics
description:
Title: Design for Tenant CloudWatch Differentiation for Logs and Metrics

Value Statement:
As an MLOps engineer who manages observability across multiple tenants, I need the ability to design a CloudWatch logging and metrics differentiation strategy so that we can cleanly separate and manage each tenant's telemetry data within our existing infrastructure.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Design includes naming conventions and resource isolation strategies.
- Documentation is added to the internal Confluence.
- Proposal includes tradeoffs, cost considerations, and implications for automated alerting and dashboards.

summary: Update Image Builder Webhook Caller Template to Support Multiple Target Pipelines
description:
As a dev ops engineer, I want a reusable Harness step template that calls the Image Builder pipeline via webhook, so that multiple different application pipelines can use the same template to trigger Image Builder with their own configuration (repo, tag, language, paths, etc.) without duplicating logic.
We currently have a Bash script used in a Run step that: Constructs a JSON payload from pipeline variables (environment, ECR repo, tag, Dockerfile directory, repo name, branch, resources, language, etc.). Sends that payload to the Image Builder pipeline via a webhook URL (ImageBuilderWebhook). Parses the trigger response using jq. Polls the provided apiUrl until the Image Builder execution finishes, failing the calling pipeline on non-success.
Reusable as a Harness Step Template The “Call Image Builder via Webhook” logic is encapsulated in a step template (e.g., a Run step template) in Harness. Any pipeline can include this template without copying the script.

summary: Update BIP AI Image Builder Pipeline to Use Custom Fortify Image
description:
Value Statement
Integrating the custom Fortify image into the BIP AI Image Builder pipeline will reduce scan execution time from the current 14-25 minutes closer to the Jenkins baseline of 3 minutes. By replacing the Accelerators managed image with our custom pre-built image, we eliminate repeated package installation time (estimated 4+ minute reduction), improving developer productivity and reducing compute costs while maintaining all existing security scanning functionality.Acceptance Criteria *  BIP AI Image Builder pipeline run step updated to reference custom Fortify image from Nexus/ECR
 *  Fortify scan execution time reduced by minimum of 4 minutes compared to current baseline
 *  All existing Fortify scan functionality verified with no regressions in security checks
 *  Performance metrics documented comparing before/after execution times
